guide.conclusion: The code is attached in the documents. An additional header file was used to change a float to string. I got the header file from the Arduino playground. I'm sure there is a better way to do it but I couldn't figure it out because I'm new to C++. I also attached a picture of the labview program. The output from the micro-controller to the computer uses a comma to separate the reactivity value and timestamp.

guide.introduction_rendered:
Inverse-kinetics is an equation that will calculate the reactivity value for the reactor (in terms of cents). The meter should start when the reactor is critical.

Relevant parts
  • Cerebot MX7cK board, OLED Screen Pmod and USB cable to computer using UART
Tools
  • Picoammeter or Current Amplifier or Electrometer or RateMeter

lines.text: To change the signal from a current chamber use a picoammeter or current amplifier. There is usually an analog voltage output for the range. The signal is usually inverted. Invert the signal using an op-amp.
lines.text_raw: To change the signal from a current chamber use a picoammeter or current amplifier. There is usually an analog voltage output for the range. The signal is usually inverted. Invert the signal using an op-amp.

lines.text: For a pulse detector us a rate meter to obtain an output voltage. Some resistors may be required to change the 0-10V output to 0-3.3V.

lines.text: Use the inverse-kinetics equation to determine reactivity.

guide.summary: A Digilent microcontroller board is used to perform inverse-kinetics on an input signal from neutron detectors. Current or pulse detectors can be used, but signal conditioning to obtain a signal of 0-3.3V is required. The setup only works on one range.
